text: Garrett v A-G [1997] 2 NZLR 332 is a cited case in New Zealand regarding claims in tort for misfeasance in public office . ==Background== Judith Garrett had lodged a complaint with the police that she had been raped by several off duty police officers. Later, when the police declined to prosecute the officers, Garrett sued the police for malfeasance for refusing to prosecute ==Held== Garrett's claim was dismissed. ==References== Category:New Zealand tort case law Category:1997 in New Zealand law Category:Court of Appeal of New Zealand cases Category:1997 in case law
title: Garrett v A-G
